title: Advanced Clause Structures
description: Complex subordination, relative clauses, and cleft sentences

sections.title: Reduced Relative Clauses
sections.explanation: Relative clauses can be reduced by omitting the relative pronoun and auxiliary verb, creating more concise academic prose.

examples.full: The study, which was conducted in 2023, reveals new findings.
examples.reduced: The study, conducted in 2023, reveals new findings.
examples.note: Remove 'which was' to create a participle phrase

examples.full: Researchers who are working on this project have made breakthroughs.
examples.reduced: Researchers working on this project have made breakthroughs.
examples.note: Remove 'who are' to create a present participle phrase

rules: Reduce with past participle when the verb is passive
Reduce with present participle when the verb is active continuous
Maintain the comma structure for non-defining clauses

sections.title: Cleft Sentences for Emphasis
sections.explanation: Cleft sentences restructure a sentence to emphasize a particular element, common in formal writing.

examples.original: The economic crisis caused the policy change.
examples.itCleft: It was the economic crisis that caused the policy change.
examples.whatCleft: What caused the policy change was the economic crisis.

examples.itCleft: It is more funding that we need.
examples.whatCleft: What we need is more funding.

rules: It-clefts: 'It + be + focused element + that/who + clause'
Use to draw attention to new or contrasting information

sections.title: Complex Subordination
sections.explanation: Advanced subordinating conjunctions create precise logical relationships in academic prose.

examples.sentence: Notwithstanding the limitations, the study provides valuable insights.
Insofar as the data is reliable, the conclusions are valid.
examples.meaning: To the extent that the data is reliable...

examples.sentence: Inasmuch as funding was limited, the scope was narrowed.

exercises.sentence: The theory, which was proposed by Einstein, changed physics.
exercises.answer: The theory, proposed by Einstein, changed physics.
exercises.explanation: Remove 'which was' and keep the past participle 'proposed'

exercises.question: Choose the correct cleft sentence for emphasis on 'the methodology'
options: It was the methodology that critics questioned.
What the methodology that critics questioned.
The methodology it was that critics questioned.
That the methodology critics questioned was.
exercises.explanation: It-cleft structure: It + was + focused element + that + clause

exercises.sentence: ___ the results were inconclusive, further research is warranted.
exercises.explanation: 'Inasmuch as' introduces a causal relationship in formal register

exercises.instruction: Create a what-cleft sentence to emphasize 'systematic analysis'
exercises.sentence: We require systematic analysis of the data.
exercises.answer: What we require is systematic analysis of the data.
exercises.explanation: What-cleft: What + subject + verb + be + emphasized element

exercises.question: Select the correctly reduced clause:
options: The participants selecting randomly showed varied responses.
The participants, randomly selected, showed varied responses.
The participants were selected randomly showed varied responses.
Selected randomly the participants showed varied responses.
exercises.explanation: Non-defining reduced clause with past participle, properly set off by commas
